newsitem.title: UK: India FinMin says no plans to borrow in int'l mkts.
newsitem.headline: India FinMin says no plans to borrow in int'l mkts.

text.p: India's Finance Minister P. Chidambaram said on Friday that the government had no plans to borrow in the international capital markets.
"India has no plans of borrowing in the international capital markets," he told reporters at a news conference in London.
Chidambaram said the government's highest priority was to reduce government borrowing.
India's Finance Minister, who met with investors and bankers here, said the main purpose of his visit was to "reaffirm our commitment to reform."
In a separate statement released at the news conference, Chidambaram said all macro-economic indicators were healthy, with economic growth expected at seven percent this year.
He also said a number of policy measures have been taken to boost public and private investment in various infrastructure industries.
